oai_dc:dc.dc:title: U.S. Senate Gallery ticket to the Impeachment Proceedings against President Andrew Johnson
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Ticket no. 335 admits the bearer to the Gallery of the United States Senate for the trial of the Impeachment of the President of the United States (President Andrew Johnson). The ticket is signed by George T. Brown, Sergeant-at-Arms for the U.S. Senate.

The Johnson impeachment proceedings were officially over once the final votes on the Second and Third Articles were taken May 26, 1868. The trial, which ended in Johnson's acquittal, concluded before this ticket could be used.
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: United States Senate
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: Johnson, Andrew, 1808-1875; Reconstruction (U.S. History, 1865-1877); United States. Congress. Senate; Trials (Impeachment); Legislative bodies as courts
